Member of the Editorial Board of the Colección Elecciones (CIS, Centro de Investigaciones Sociológicas)

Member of the Editorial Board of the Revista Espanola de Ciencia Politica (http://recyt.fecyt.es/index.php/recp/about/editorialTeam)

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Electoral consequences of social policies in the Spanish democracy: a limit or an enrichment of economic voting theory? 9th European School on Historical and Comparative Sociological Research on Social Policy, Budapest, December: 6-9. Paper presenter
1998. The politics of unemployment. The Spanish experience in comparative perspective. Conference on Unemployment’s effects. Princeton University. Paper presenter
Explaining 14 years of socialist power in democratic Spain (1982-1996). ECPR Joint Session of Workshops. Mannheim, 26-31 March. Paper presenter

1999: Economic Expectations in Spain (1986-1996): A rationalization of voting decisions? European Consortium for Sociological Research. Workshop: Causes and Consequences of Socio-economic and Political attitudes in Eastern and Western Europe. Mannheim, 6-8 October. Paper presenter
Patterns of family formation in the UK. American Sociological Association, Whashinton DC. Agosto 12-16 (with Richard Breen & C Ianelli). Paper presenter
Economic Voting in Spain during the 1990s.Special Conference on Institutions and Economic Voting. Trondheim, Norway. April 9-12, Paper presenter
Political sophistication and democratic accountability: an examination of the Spanish case. ECPR Joint Session in Turin, 22-27 March. Paper presenter
Political Knowledge and the logic of voting: a comparative approach. ECPR General Conference. Budapest, 8-10 Sep. Paper presenter
Organizer of the workshop 11. “Political Culture and electoral behaviour across regions: a multilevel perspective” at VI Congreso de Ciencia Política y de la Administración. Madrid
Social Determinants of political consumerism in Europe: a contribution to the death of social class debate. European Comparative Sociological Research Conference. Paris: 25 & 26 Nov. Paper presenter

Is protest a “normalised” political phenomenon? Exploring the determinants of political protest across multilevel contexts. ECPR Joint Session in Nicosia, Cyprus, April 25-30. (with Mariona Ferrer). Paper presenter

The context of demonstrations in Spain: a comparative analysis of three different regional contexts in Spain (the Basque Country, Catalonia and Madrid). ECPR General Conference, Pisa. September 6-8. (with Mariona Ferrer). Paper presenter
Exploring individual and contextual determinants of political consumerism in Europe. 38th World Congress of the International Institute of Sociology. Budapest, June 26-30. Paper presenter

Measuring public attitudes towards surveys in Spain. Presented at 7th International Conference on Social Science Methodology, Naples (Italy), September 1-5 (with Monica Mendez and Joan Font). Paper presenter
Economics and Elections in Spain (1982-2008): Cross-Measures, Cross-Time. ECPR General Conference, Postdam. September 8-10. (with Michael Lewis-Beck). Paper presenter
Widening or reducing the Knowledge gap? Testing the media effects on Political Knowledge in Spain (2004-2006). March 22-27, ECPR Joint Sessions (Munster). Paper presenter
Exploring the media effects in Knowledge: A comparative study of the 2009 European electoral campaigns. November 18-19. PIREDEU Final Conference (Brussels). Paper presenter
Testing the Knowledge Gap: A Comparison of Traditional Media and Internet in Finland and Spain. Second Symposium on Political Communication, Segovia, 17-18 March. Paper presenter
Explaining the Persistent Gender Gap in Knowledge in Europe. Nuffield Political Science Seminars. Nuffield College, 25 October. Paper presenter (invited guess)
Multi-Dimensional Economic Voting in Spain: the 2008 Elections. “The New Evonomic Voter” Shambaugh Conference, March 22-25. University of Iowa (Iowa City). Paper presenter

Economic, Ideology, and the Spanish Voter: Causality Issues and Panel Data (2000-2011). International Seminar “Change in Political Attitudes: Panels and Experiments”, UAB, 7-8 June (Barcelona). Paper presenter
Are there gender inequalities in civic knowledge of European adolescent? ELECDEM final Conference, 28-30 June (EUI) (with Monica Ferrín and Martiño Rubal).Paper presenter
Director of the Panel RC21.186 (Inequalities in Political Knowledge: Individual and Contextual Determinants). IPSA, XX World Congress of Political Science. Madrid, 8-12 July (2012)
Can knowledge inequalities be reduced? A comparative analysis of Europe. IPSA, XX World Congress of Political Science. Madrid, 8-12 July. Paper presenter

Does deliberation contribute to a decrease of the Gender Gap in Knowledge? Presented at EuroPolis seminar at the Center for Deliberative Democracy, Stanford University, 30 November – 2 December. Paper presenter
Exploring Differences in Political Knowledge of Boys and Girls in Europe (with Monica Ferrín and Martiño Rubal). 3rd European Conference on Politics and Gender. Barcelona 21-23 March. Paper presenter
Studying the persistent gender gap in political knowledge: evidence from Greece (with Pavlos Vasilopoulos). 3rd European Conference on Politics and Gender. Barcelona 21-23 March. Paper presenter
Contextual Determinants of the Latin American Gender Gap in Political Knowledge (with Raul Gómez). EPSA 3rd annual Conference. Barcelona 20-23 June. Paper presenter
The gender gap political knowledge. Is it all about guessing? (with Monica Ferrín and Gema García). ESA Conference 28-31 August. Paper presenter

Director of the Workshop: “Resources, abilities, motivation and what else? Studying Inequalities in Political Knowledge in Democratic Systems”. Organized at ECPR Joint Sessions, Salamanca: 10-15 April (2014) (https://ecpr.eu/Events/PanelList.aspx?EventID=12)
The Informative Effects of incidental on line exposure to news: a panel analysis. ECPR Joint Sessions, Salamanca: 10-15 April (with Carolina Galais). Paper presenter
What is Politics? An empirical assessment about the meaning of politics. EPSA 4th annual Conference. Edinburgh, June 19-21. (with Monica Ferrín, Gema Garcia and Raul Gómez). Paper presenter
Inequalities in political knowledge. Is it all about guessing? An experimental approach EPSA 4th annual Conference. Edinburgh, June 19-21. (with Monica Ferrín and Gema Garcia).Paper presenter

Political Knowledge of Young People. Conference ‘Youth, Politics and Society. What Makes Adolescents Learn in the 21st Century?’ 9-10 . September 2014. Centre for Citizenship and Democracy, KU Leuven. (with Monica Ferrín and Gema Garcia). Paper presenter

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Research Study for Fundación Alternativas (http://www.fundacionalternativas.org/la-fundacion): Cuánto saben los ciudadanos de política Interview for the newspaper El Periodico where I summarize the main findings of the study: 10/11/2006. “A menores recursos, mayor abstención” (http://www.lourdesmunozsantamaria.cat/I MG/pdf/MenystensmesabstencioElperiodico. pdf)
Centro de Investigaciones Sociologicas. Informe Metodologico: La Medicion de la exposicion a medios y el conocimiento politico de los ciudadanos.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Tre sessenni di ricerca riconosciuti dalla Comisión Nacional Evaluadora de la Actividad Investigadora, 1998-2003, 2004-2009 e 2010-2015 (http://www.mecd.gob.es/servicios-al-ciu dadano-mecd/catalogo/general/educacion/0 50920/ficha.html) del ministero dell'istruzione Spagnolo. Nota: per ogni sessennio viene valutata la qualità di 5 articoli scelti dal candidato, in base all'impact factor della rivista e il numero di citazioni ottenute)

Premio-Distinción Jaime Viçens Vivens a la Calidad Docente Universitaria (2004) for the proyect “Villa Pompeu” (with Miquel Salvador) (Diari oficial de la Generalitat de Catalunya num 4225, de 23 de Septiembre de 2004)
Certificato di Abilitazione nazionale come professore associato (Profesor Titular de Universidad) del Ministerio de Educación y Ciencia, Spagna dal 14-03-2006

2008. Premio Synovate a la contribución más innovadora en el campo de la metodología de encuestas por su presentación en el V Congreso de Metodología de encuestas. 24-26 de Septiembre, Córdoba (Spain)

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Statistical Analysis for Social Sciences (I), Pompeu-Fabra University, Barcelona; PhD programme of the Department of Political Science. One semester compulsory course, four consecutive years
Research Design in Political Science, Autonoma University of Madrid; PhD programme of the Department of Political Science. One semester course. Four consecutive years
Two days Seminar: “Methods Clinic” for PhD students of the SPS department of the EUI (total of 16h)
